page.title: 12THE LOCAL COUNCIL
page.content: Lancaster City Council covers 218.4 miles including the area around Wennington; its population is 118,589 with an annual turnover of about Â£200,000,000. The council has 60 members. Although there are 38 Conservative councillors, voting, which is on a show of hands, tends to be done on personal rather than party grounds. Each member may claim an attendance allowance and on average spends 59 hours a month on council work. Meetings take place every 6 weeks except for the Planning Committee which meets fortnightly. There are 6 main committees: Policy and Resources, Planning, Housing, Tourism and Leisure, Transportation, and Environmental Health. There are several sub-committees and working groups within each main committee.
